"You see, Agent Sterling," Control says, steepling his hands as he leans over his desk toward you, "there really is no other way that we are going to pull this off."

No matter how many times he reassures you, you can't help but feel a little apprehensive. But then, who wouldn't be? Being smuggled into the stronghold of a dangerous wannabe-dictator terrorist was never going to be fun at the best of times, but you can only imagine how many times worse it will be when you are confined to a height of only one inch.

"It's the only reliable way to get past the security systems, you see," Control continues.

Most people would probably be a little disbelieving of a plan that involved a shrinking machine, but in your line of work you've seen gadgets that are a whole lot more bizarre.

"But how am I to get there in the first place?" you ask, nervously tapping your foot on the floor.

"Don't worry about that. You'll be taken to the base by Miss Hensley."

You follow his gaze over your shoulder, to where a young woman has just entered the room. Her short skirt reveals perfect legs, and you follow them up to a body that matches. Maybe there will be an upside to this mission after all...

"Ahem."

You turn back to hear the rest of the briefing, noting out of the corner of your eye that Miss Hensley takes one of the seats at the back of the room.

"As I was saying, you'll be taken to the base by Miss Hensley, who will drop you off on one of the personnel of the base, where you will proceed to -"

The room turns out to be quite small, appropriately enough. Perhaps they converted a broom cupboard into this high-tech laboratory when headquarters otherwise ran out of space; enough rock below London has been dug out already to facilitate the facility's needs, so space has become a premium of late.

Which is probably why the shrinking machine was invented.

To yours eyes it appears to be nothing more than an astounding array of tubes and piping, intertwined with electrical cables arranged about a central booth with a swivel chair. Blinking lights on a monitor to your left would seem to indicate that it is active.

"Good afternoon, Professor Taylor," Miss Hensley says.

You look about for who she's talking to, as you'd noticed no one else in the chamber when youe entered. Then you follow her gaze, and see the most astounding sight of your long and varied life.

Standing atop one of the horizontal pipes - which, upon this closer inspection, you notice sports a diminutive handrail - is a labcoat wearing gentleman no more than an inch tall. As he waves up at Miss Hensley's imposing form, you can't help 'Fraggle Rock' coming to mind.

"You see," she says, "we're already using this machine to make full use of available space. At some point all employees will be reduced while in this building."

"An exciting prospect, I'm sure," you say, nervous again. "I sit there, then?"

"Of course. Once you're strapped in, Professor Taylor will begin the process."

You sit, and she fastens velcro bands around your chest and limbs, cold metal discs pressing into the skin of your hands and forehead. From the corner of your eye you see Taylor move to a bank of switches and dials that hadn't been visible from a distance.

"Being an inch-tall will be an... interesting experience, I'm sure."

"Oh yes, we're keeping you at a centimetre height for this mission. Far smaller than anyone's ever gone before, but I'm sure that an experienced agent such as yourself is not averse to trying something new, taking risks where done before have dared, hmm?"

You smirk and nod, straightening your suit where lying down had creased it. Then Miss Hensley is directly above you, her eye larger than your body. The moment comes when her stare is broken by the batting of her tremendous eyelids, and you allow yourself to know fear.

"Wow," she says, her voice even louder now that she's at such a close proximity, "you've managed to keep your rugged good looks even at that scale, Sterling."

"What? Did you say something?"

"Oh,of course," Taylor says. "You're far too small for regular people to hear, I'm afraid. You'll be wanting one of these if you want to communicate using anything other than semaphore."

He hands you an interesting lapel button, and you affix it before trying your line again. You never were one to stick too closely to protocol, and you're sure that her words are almost an invitation. That, and you'll learn more about your condition from putting your body to the test than you will being talked to by a scientist that probably hasn't left this facility for months.

Keep helping yourself out
11522111.content:
You take in pertinent facts quickly. The room's other occupant is no help, oblivious to you and too young to endanger in your high-risk business. The door, only means of exit, is closed, and far beyond your half-inch tall means of escape. There is a window, through which a comfortable breeze flows, but that is far, far from the ground.

So: how to get to that window? The girl's desk sits beneath it, a four-columned temple of immense magnitude, beneath its ceiling not worshippers, but gigantic heaps of unwashed clothes and discarded snack wrappers.

The chair is lower, yet there is still some gap between it and the table-top. To get up there, you'll have to fashion some form of climbing gear.

And, lo and behold, raw materials are all around you! With a cautious glance at the dancing teenager, you approach the upturned hairbrush that lies to your left like a plastic maze. Each bristle is taller than you, but they're not what you want. With delicate motions you are able to unwind thick lengths of discarded hair, thicker than your finger and stronger by far. What a thought, that human hair should be tough enough to support your weight! All you need now is some form of grapnel...

Your thoughts are disturbed as the girl stamps back toward you, and it looks like she may be about to grab the brush! You could hitch a ride with it, although you could very well die scraped against her scalp, or maybe you should evade her and continue to scrounge items from the floor.
11522111.title: World's Biggest Prison Cell

11522112.content:
You navigate the titanic piles of junk and rubbish as you head for the teenage titaness. As you approach her terrifyingly colossal and active bare feet striding around without a care in the world, you look up to notice that a pair of earphones leads are jutting out of her dark, dyed red hair and that her eyes are closed. One more of her steps and a wall of soft flesh is all you can see as you are encased in this woman's shadow. Time seemed to slow as the awful stench of her foot-sweat started to engulf your nose and the air around you was displaced so violently by the punk goddess that it seemed like it was about to pick up off of your feet.

But it didn't.

You were crushed into a bloody paste. The world's top secret agent reduced to nothing more than a tiny, little smear on a 17-year-old girl's sole.

"Ew!" she screamed out, finally noticing your presence. "Mom was right. I need to clean up my room..."
11522112.title: One bad decision

choices: Using your spy gadgets, you attempt an escape
Harold gives you to the woman
Harold plans to kill you immediately
Harold plans to feed you to his cat (white, of course)
Harold plans to use you in his scheme
12.content:
"Ah, glad to see you are back with us, Mister Sterling."

The voice is that of Harold Salisbury, international arms dealer and terrorist of no small reputation. He's gone by many other names in his time, of course, but that is his original, the one by which you first knew him when you read his file.

You shake your head to clear it a little. The drug that Salisbury's goons gave you was strong, no doubt about that. You have no idea how long you've been out, but judging by the gloating tone in your adversary's voice, he has you at his mercy.

It's a shame that he doesn't have any.

As your vision clears, you see that you have been strapped down to a metallic table. Manacles bind you to it so strongly that you are unable to move your limbs at all. Suspended above you by a copious amount of wiring and rigging, is an ominous looking device with its barrel pointed straight at you.

"Unfortunately, it won't be for long."

You can still move your neck, and look up to see Salisbury standing at the foot of the table. His fat face is twisted in a sneer, and he holds a glass of red wine in one hand. The other arm is around the beautiful young woman that you were with last night - now you can see her true colours plainly enough. Behind them both, boiler-suited flunkies attend to knobs and dials on a computer bank that dominates the entire wall, flashing lights probably communicating something to them but meaning nothing to you.

"So you're going to try and slice me up with a laser again, Harry?" you say. "Have you run out of original ideas?"

Salisbury smiles fully now, taking a sip of his drink as the woman on his arm giggles. "No, that's no laser. It is, however, something that will cut you down to size, sure enough. You've interfered in my plots for the final time."

He turns to nod at his underlings, and one of them slams down a large lever that dominates the front of their computer. There is a crackle of electrical discharge, a venting of steam, and then the weapon above you fires.

Yo are enveloped in a coccoon of orange light, but rather than burn you it merely causes you to writhe as you feel your muscles being stretched to their limits. Your very brain is contorting out of shape, and it is a mercy when you black out again.

***

You awaken once more to feel your wrists and ankles freed from restraint. And, more importantly, you're alive! Someone must have freed you, and in the nick of time, too!

As you sit up, smiling ruggedly, you realise that you haven't escaped at all. You're still on the same metal table. Only now it stretches out in all directions for a vast distance. The manacles that once held you are now magnificent arches, capable of holding two or three men your size standing on each others' shoulders.

You've been shrunk!

The panic that is welling up in your diminutive frame is replaced by terror as you see Salisbury and his female acquaintance stride into view, colossal giants whose very presence causes you to drop to your knees. They're so big - what chance do you have?

"Oh, it worked, Harold!" the woman trills, clapping her hands together. Both the sound of her voice and the explosion of her flesh meeting flesh is deafeningly loud, even at the vast distance that separates you.

She bends over to get a closer look, and you are afforded a front row seat observing her not0inconsiderable breasts trying to burst out of the low-cut dress that she wears. You remember them being large last night, but now they are larger than buildings...

"Do you think you could let me have him, Harold?" she asks. "After your men interrupted us last night, we didn't get to finish what we started, and I'm sure he'd be much more agreeable at this size..."

"Perhaps, my dear. But I already have plans for Mister Sterling..."

That sounded ominous.
12.title: No, I expect you to SHRINK!

choices: Try to get more details of Salisbury's operation
Escape first, information later
121.content:
Luckily, you are prepared for any eventuality. Well, you'd never been expecting these exact circumstances to come up, but you are perfectly able to improvise.

Salisbury's goons weren't that careful when they searched you, apparantly. While your high-tech spy watch has been confiscated, the fools left you your cufflinks!

With a twist of one of them, Harold's female associate is reeling backwards as a blinding flash detonates before you.

The activation of the second throws out an impromptu parachute (the one thing you'd thought would NEVER come in handy on this mission) which you use to drift to the suddenly far away ground.

As you ditch your tiny kerchief, you cast your eyes around for somewhere to hide. Crushing feet are stomping toward your position as minions mobilise to try and recapture you, with Harold's screeching tone demanding that he wants you alive.

In the opposite direction to the giants, you spot salvation. Normally, having ventilation shafts big enough to accommodate inquisitive do-gooders would be the downfall of a villain's scheme. Salisbury must have thought himself very smart when he downsized them.

More fool him; they're the perfect scale for you to escape without being followed, as it's too small for regular-sized people.

Another cufflink contains a mini-cutting torch, which expends its entire battery charge sawing through the grille, but just in time to allow you to scamper away to freedom!

Well, not quite.

There's a long way to go if you're to get out of this place, not to mention finding some way to contact your superiors and get restored to your proper size. None of the gizmos you still have on you function as any form of communication device!

So it's gonna be a long, hard climb out of this hell hole.
121.title: You Have To Get Up Pretty Early In The Morning...

choices: Follow them through the ventilation system
Grab onto the woman
1211.content:
You're perfectly safe in the vent right where you are - they'll expect you to be heading for escape straight away, and be moving to cut you off. Staying in one place is the safest thing you can do at the moment.

With that in mind, you walk closer to the grille where you entered, and gaze back out at the giant world. You still can't get over how big everything appears! If Salisbury has such a weapon at his disposal, he's a much bigger threat than he's ever been - and soon you'll be able to say that literally.

But where did he appropriate such technology? You'd best keep close tabs on him until you can get to the bottom of this mystery.

"FIND HIM!" the villain is screeching, and your limited viewpoint can make out the boiler-suited flunkies running away to carry out his command. Soon only Salisbury and his lady friend remain in the room, the former leaning against the slab, the latter standing nearer the vent.

"My dear, I must apologise for allowing that pest to ruin the entertainment that I had lined up for you," he continues, in a calmer tone of booming voice.

"Oh, no need!" she replies, one monstrous step bringing her right up to the vent, blocking your view of everything save her calf. "I'm sure that it was my fault!"

"Well, if it'll make you feel better I can have the blame assigned to some minion and throw him into a deathtrap later," Salisbury says with the serious tone of the genuinely mentally deranged. "Now come, while we wait for the apprehension of that insect, we can properly plan our conquest of the world!"

This looks like it! No doubt the megalomaniac and his consort are off to meet with the creator of the device and a host of other assembled tacticians and conspirators, where you'll be able to gather just the information you need to thwart him.

But how to get there? You'll never match their speed to keep up with them, so either you'll need to try and track them through the ventilation system - even though there are people scouring these very passages for any sign of you - or you could grab onto the woman and let her carry you there - even though the risks there should speak for themselves. Which is it to be?
1211.title: Good Luck, Suckers

choices: They begin to learn about the weapon
You decide to debark the woman at this point
12112.content:
Peering closely through the grate, you spy the skin of this woman's calf. With a true spy's lightning-quick problem solving ability, you see this as a rare and valuable opportunity and seize it immediately.

You grab tightly on to one of the beautiful woman's leg hairs. Leg Hairs? Surprised, you look upwards and see that her shapely leg is indeed covered in hairs, though they be thin and transparent, so hardly visible to a normal-sized human. You think it over. Yes, the leg hairs are actually kind of attractive on this woman.

Abruptly she begins walking, following Salisbury. You suddenly feel that you don't want to endure this journey hanging on for dear life to a beautiful woman's leg hair. So you quickly grab the one above, and with your superhuman climbing skills, you climb and climb. You rest for a minute in the tawny crook of the back of her knee, then continue on upward, searching for somewhere safe and with a view. Thankfully, the long spandex shorts she is wearing under her skirt are an even easier climbing surface. Once you reach her muscular thigh, therefore, the threads of the form-fitting underwear grip your feet and hands and allow you to quickly ascend to the waistband of her skirt.

Carefully, you side-step around to the front of this pretty and powerful woman. Soon enough, you feel safe at the front of her skirt's waistband, your feet held securely by the loops of thread. You hold your position there, unnoticed, only your torso held above her skirt, as the scene develops before you.
12112.title: Spy-Skills in Action

choices: Get to the table to get visual confirmation
Stay in place and gather more evidence
121121.content:
From your position in the woman's waistband, you get a brief view of the room and its occupants - the former large and glossy, with mapped walls, the latter one lab-coated man among the boiler-suited masses - Before she sits down at a table, crossing her legs and blocking all sight to the outside world. You can, however, hear well enough the conversation of the giants.

"It worked perfectly!" Salisbury is telling someone eagerly. "Sterling may have escaped, but in his present condition, he'll be no obstacle to my plans!"

"How many times before have you said that?" the woman above you drones.

Salisbury seems to ignore her, continuing to talk to the mysterious third party. "The weapon is ingenious, perfect for my designs! That one test run was not enough - I must have more!"

The voice that replies is calmer, more controlled, and seems all the more dangerous for it. "Then you will meet my price, Mister Salisbury?"

There's a certain familiarity to that second speaker, but you can't quite put your finger on who it could be! If only you could see their face, you could confirm your suspicions! Looking up the leg to the knee that crosses above you, you reckon that you could climb it to the table, get a quick peek around the room and be back in hiding before you're spotted. There's a risk though, and perhaps it would be safer to remain in place and gather solely audio information for the time being.
121121.title: Third party

choices: Flee!
Stand your ground
122.content:
"My plan, of course, is malleable," Harold announces. "There is no set time-table, and so you may take some time to rest and recuperate before Phase II begins, Agent Stirling."

He raises his glass to you before walking away. The giantess gives one look toward him before returning to look at you, beaming with the pleasure that you expect a cat must deign to grant its prey in the moment before the killing strike.

Her hand moves in toward you, fingers outsretched to grab you. By your estimation, you must be around an inch and a half high, so any attempt by this woman to pick you up would doubtless be painful. With Harold's attention elsewhere, this could be a chance to escape.

However, perhaps you could work your charms on this woman, swing her around to your side (even from your diminished bargaining position), so you may want to stick around.
122.title: Lesser of Two Evils?

choices: The woman slams her hand down in front of you
The woman dives across the table at you, knocking it over
A minion walks over to assist the woman in apprehending you
1221.content:
You can, no doubt, outwit a single woman. No matter how large she may be.

You are already running as her fingers swoop through the air, and an annoyed grunt from so far above you in the heavens indicates that you may have ticked her off more than a little. She's coming after you angry, and that will make her sloppy.

Sure enough, now fists are raining down in your wake, the woman thinking only to smash you, rather than apply a little common sense and cut off your line of retreat; she should be aiming for where you will be, not where you are at the time of striking.

Then the moment you feared approaches. The edge of the hard, metal table is nearing, and the drop to the floor is considerable. You've never planned very far ahead before, so there's no undue cause for concern. Something will come up. Something always does.
1221.title: Flee!

choices: Try to escape.
Fight!
12211.content:
You reach the edge of the table and turn around, just in time to see a gigantic fist slam right in front of you. You stare up at it, easily 15 feet high from your point of view, knowing that had it landed an inch closer, it would have shattered all your bones in a single pound. You had to decide what to do, and fast.

Trying your charms against her was useless now, as she now had just one idea in her mind: crush you. This now leaves you with two options: either try to find a way to get to the floor and escape, or use your gadgets as well as your combat training to fight this titaness. Both options were too risky, but in your position, you couldn't get too picky.
12211.title: The woman slams her hand down in front of you.

choices: She knocks down the table.
Instead of trying to pound you, she uses both hands to try and grab you.
122112.content:
You aren't known for being a coward, as you've never ran from a fight before; and you aren't starting now! Sure, this time, your opponent is around 250' tall compared to you, but she's still just a normal woman, and you aren't running away from a woman, especially when she's not even trained for battle. Besides, you're an expert in one on one combat, and you've learned how to use the opponent's weight and strength against there, so this shouldn't be that tough.

Before she even had a chance to lift her fist up, you strike its fingers with a couple of punches and a kick.
"Ouch!", she says, lifting her hand up quickly, letting you know your attack made effect. "Grrr! Now I'm gonna show you!".
As intimidating as she looks at that size, and even more when angry, you don't show any sign of fear. She uses the same "fist tactic" as before, which you already know well. Without much effort, you dodge a few fist slams and repeat the attack. This woman seems to be even dumber than you expected.

"OK, that's it!", she says, furiously. "You're going down!"
You just wait there, now not afraid anymore of this mountain of a woman, and just wait there for her next move.
122112.title: Fight!

choices: Escape.
Keep fighting!
1221121.content:
She grabs the opposite edge of the table with both hands and starts to lift it, causing you to slide down. As much as you try to climb it, the surface is too smooth, and you eventually slide down. Fortunately for you, the table's edge is now lower, as she holds it, and you are able to land on the floor with little trouble.

"Phew! That was close!", you say to yourself, just as you start to feel the floor trembling. A second later, a pair of colossal heels is standing right in front of you, each big enough to crush you to oblivion. You stare up, and up, and up...all the way up her body to her face, which now looks pissed.

"Now you're mine, little mouse!", she says, her hands on her hips. Now you need to decide again: Either try to outrun her and escape, or keep fighting.
1221121.title: She knocks down the table.

choices: Crushed you right there
Grabbed you from under her foot
12211211.content:
You again turn to run away and possible reach the door but this woman has had enough. She raise her right heel over you then quickly slammed it down on you pinning you to the ground. You could faintly hear her giggling under her shoe as you try to struggle and escape.

"Well that was quite the exercise Mr. Stirling" you hear her muffled voice say as she applies more pressure on you. You are in loads of pain as this huge mass continues to crush you. You were completely vulnerable as she...
12211211.title: Not this time

choices: Let's give her a moment...
Help!  Help! Help me , heeellllp!
1222.content:
You weren't wrong on that 'crushing pain' theory. As the woman's forefinger and thumb move in on either side of you, they pin your arms to your sides and squeeze your bones out of shape. Taking a breath turns out to be quite difficult.

Then the woman raises you into the air, with an accelerated ascent not unlike a reverse drop from a 'plane. Certainly strange, and enough to turn your stomach.

You have nowehere else to look besides her face, dominating utterly the horizon before you. That predatory look is in her eyes again, and an elephant-sized tongue slowly slithers out to lick at her lips briefly in anticipation of what she's going to do to you.

Should you wait to see what she does next, or try talking to her right now?
1222.title: Okay, so...

choices: The woman follows after him obediently.
The woman starts looking for you and finds the hole you cut.
123.content:
"You see Mister Sterling," Salisbury voices proudly, "You have foiled my plans far too many times in the past, and there is no doubt you would continue to do so in the future. You have also cheated death with more lives than that of a cat. Your reputation is invincible." He grins wide, "But this time you won't be so fortunate." He squeezes his fist tight then sticks out his big thumb. He reaches down from the dark heavens.

Unable to run, as that's just not in your character, you stand strong as doom drops down overhead. You calmly reach into your pocket and retrieve what seems to be an ordinary pen, only with a careful aim and a press of a button, it transforms. Smoke seeps out and rockets ignite to propel the needle-like instrument skyward, spiraling, piercing into Salisbury's skin.

He shouts, whines, and retracts his crushing assault, turning away and nursing his punctured digit. His female companion crowds close by him with her back to you and both villains are effectively distracted, providing you the perfect chance to dive for freedom over the table's edge.

You fall through the cold air toward the two giants, and when the time is right, you fire a hooked cable from your wristwatch. It whips out and latches on to the woman's dress just below her hips. With this new anchor point, you swing toward her and softly land against the wall of fabric. Cutting through the fabric with a miniature saw in your cufflink, you detach and reel in the cable and slip in under the woman's dress covertly, the whole operation taking mere seconds in silence.

In the confusion of the outside world, Salisbury realizes you've disappeared from his grasp, "Where did he? Find him! He couldn't have run far at his size. Start searching, but capture him alive! I want him brought to me directly so I may personally witness his demise!" He sucks on his sore thumb again and storms out of the room. You hold tight to his fretting female friend, hidden between her bare skin and taut cloth.
123.title: Cheating Death

choices: Climb the woman
Look for an alternate shelter
1231.content:
"Oh darling, are you okay?" the woman purrs, rushing after Salisbury.

At least, you presume that she is rushing after Salisbury. Beneath her dress, clinging tight as her powerful leg moves back and forth to propel her forward, you find that you have very little sense of direction. The full focus of your concentration is applied to keeping your position, for were you to fall things would go badly for you. Worse, if the woman were to feel you scrambling around, the jig would most certainly be 'up'.

None the less, you can make out snatches of conversation from the greater world outside.

"Get away from me, you incompetent!" Salisbury snarls, and the woman stumbles back a pace before halting, giving you time to catch your breath and rest easy for a moment. "I've been humiliated! Even when he's small enough to be ground out like a cigarette, that Sterling still manages to confound me! I think that I may well move forward the timetable, just to let off some steam. In the end, all that Sterling has managed to achieve is a swifter demise for the democracy that he soo valiantly defends."

"But darling," the woman seems worried, "won't lots of people die?"

"Of course. Then people will be more willing to acquiesce to my extortionate demands. It's no surprise that you're not the brains of this operation. Now attend me! I think that it's time someone else was sucking my thumb..."

The noises that ensue aren't ones that you want to think on too much, but the woman should be distracted for the moment while she tends to Salisbury's wound. That gives you an opportunity. You could either climb for higher ground on her body, or move out of the hole in her dress and grapnel across to a different surface.
1231.title: Rage

choices: Submit
Give her the ol' runaround
124.content:
"For years," Salisbury continues, "you have mocked me, Sterling. Called me insane, ridiculed each and every one of my masterful schemes!"

"I thought that someone of your limited intelligence would need help in seeing the joke," you jibe back. "Seemed easier than getting your little white kitty cat to explain it to you."

"Ha. Funny that you should mention Napoleon, Sterling. It's been some time since he was last fed, and now you're in the perfect state to feed him yourself."

Of all the lame death traps that you've been subjected to by your arch-nemesis, this must be up in the top three most silly. Perhaps you'll learn to shut your big mouth one of these days.

"I would love to do the honours myself," Harold says, "but I have a world to conquer, and no time to waste. I think it only fitting that you be lowered into the jaws of death by the very woman that lured you here. For once, the pussy will eat you, Mister Sterling."

He strides off, laughing maniacally, leaving you to the tender mercies of his delectable assistant. She introduced herself as Wendy Windblows last night, but somehow you doubt that that's her real name. The willowy physique that first caught your eye has now been magnified, making her a mountainous monster whose every move inspires terror as she walks closer. One massive hand brushes brunette hair behind one ear as she cranes down, smiling with teeth taller than you.

"Bitch," you tell her.

"Oh, you so shouldn't have said that," she replies, reaching for you quickly.
124.title: Wendy Windblows

choices: She feeds you to the cat
She plans to do something even MORE diabolical to you!
1242.content:
You're far from finished yet! You daash away from her ponderous hand, away across the slab that had once restrained you, sprinting for all your worth and hoping that the slow-witted giantess Wendy can't catch you.

It is a futile hope, of course. She was only slow before because she had no need for speed. Now, with her target in danger of getting away, she lashes out faster than you'd imagine possible for a lumbering behemoth like her. But then, it's hard to appreciate that she is still regular size, with regular physical attributes, and it is you who are the changed one!

Her palm impacts before you, and in your rush you collide with the wall of flesh. The bones beneath the surface are hard, and despite the padding offered by her silky skin it hurts bad. You sink to the ground in pain and then she has you, hand scooping you up effortlessly.

"I was going to be merciful to you," Wendy says, "but after that little outburst I think you've lost your right to it."
1242.title: Mercy Squandered

choices: Apologise; being shrunk has gotten you scared.  You need her help...
Make some suggestions for things she can do before she kills you
12422.content:
"Seems a waste to commit the legendary secret agent to the belly of a cat," Wendy purrs, raising you before her face and inspecting you all over with those gigantic eyes of hers. "I'm sure that I can find a way to make your demise far more memorable."

Okay, this is better. If there's one thing that you've had more experience with than daring car chases and rocket explosions, it's saving yourself from deadly femmes fatale. All you need do is turn on the charm, convince Wendy that you're more use alive; you wish you hadn't called her a bitch...
12422.title: The Giantess Wants You For Herself!

choices: You agree to join his organization and are enlarged slightly.
Daisy grabs the sizing device, "Oh, let me try this, Harold!"
125.content:
"It is true that you have interfered with my schemes for the final time," Salisbury preaches with another proud sip of wine. Swirling the glass, he continues, "From this moment on, you will be working for me, a most valued associate I predict." His surprised dame puffs, "Oh, Harold! You are so smart." Salisbury smiles and nods and takes another small dip in his wine, all eyes affixed on you as you start to your feet. The woman gasps with smile as your tiny shoes tap on metal tabletop.

"We all know I will never be your subordinate Salisbury!" You hope your shout travels to distant ears. "You can never make me take orders from you!" The bountiful beauty above once again draws near, her bosom pressing against the world's edge as she leans her statuesque face over you. "Did you hear that, Harold?" her voice shakes steel. "He says he won't do what you say."

Salisbury is still smugly silent, his bulbous head bobbing up and down consistently. He sets his glass on the far corner of metal map and speaks up, "I think he will, my dear Daisy." Your observing moon returns to space beside her king of planets. He continues to insist, "Our foolish, little Mister Sterling is unaware of many important facts." You take a brave step with fist raised toward his orbit, "You facts are an illusion, Harry!"

He smiles, reaching into his coat as he carries on with his proposal, "Please, please, Jack. Let me show you what I know is fact." His hand returns from deep pockets, a small, white device in his stubby fingers. He runs thumb across its hidden face high above, and much to his delight and Daisy's wonder, a sharp sickness sticks inside you. You again fall to your knees, "What's happening to me!? Salisbury!" you collapse onto the cold ground.

Your ears awake first to the voice of that incorrigible Daisy, "You did it again, Harry!? You didn't tell me about that!" And as you open your eyes, you see she is absolutely right as she rises tall to the stars in the ceiling. You crawl along, quickly evolving legs to stand once more, though you reserve your microscopic words for a better time.

"You see Mister Sterling," Salisbury states, "if you don't help me, you will disappear into nothing." He laughs a humble rumble, "But should you cooperate with my plans, you will live." Daisy's big, curious eyes keep watch on the remote in Harold's hand as he concludes, "So either way, the power is mine. I would prefer you to lend your skill to my operation, Sterling," he turns aside, "but either way, you will never cause trouble for me again!"
125.title: Other Operation

choices: She reveals herself to be Agent 97, your occasional partner.
You decide to try and charm your way out of this situation.
1251.content:
The sad fact that the great Jack Sterling has not only been defeated, but manipulated into helping a long time adversary finally sinks in, breaking your cocky, arrogant spirit. Not wanting to shrink out of existence, you conclude that you have no choice but to accept Harold's proposal.

"You win", you shout up at your new employer, if you can call him that.

Of course, seeing as how you are microscopic, your captors are unable to hear you. after a few minutes of ackward silence, Harold finally realizes your predicament.

"Oh, right. Sorry", Harold apologizes in a somewhat embarrased tone.

Once again, you are overtaken with pain, only this time doesn't seem quite as wretched as before. Perhaps this process isn't so bad once a person adapts to it.

You find yourself at about three inches high when you stop growing. You were hoping to have been enlarged back to a more manageable height, but anything is better than the microscopic demensions your body held just a few seconds ago.

"I'll cooperate", you concede to your longtime nemesis, "but what exactly is it you want me to do"?

Daisy giggles loudly. "Let me tell him, Harry", Daisy begs Harold, adding, "Please".

You cover your ears, but this does you little good. Your ears are ringing with the thunderous tone in which Daisy speaks.

"Alright dear, go ahead", Harold permits.

"Alone, silly", Daisy demands.

"Hmmm, I suppose there is no harm in that", Harold says, probably conceding this just to keep his dimwited flavor of the month happy.

"Yayyyy", Daisy exclaims happily.

With that, Daisy's car-sized hand quickly engulfs you. Your elevation shifts constantly as you can feel Daisy's hand swing back and forth carelessly. The ride is rather dreadful.

Finally, you hear a monstrous thud, which you conclude is a door slammed shut through your headache. After a bit more movement, your fleshy prison opens as Daisy's face eclipses you from the light in the room. From the position of her head and arm, as well as the soft looking surface directly below, you conclude that Daisy is lying stomach down on a bed of some kind.

"Alright...", Daisy begins.
1251.title: Your new mission?

choices: "I'm actually on a different mission altogether".
"Let's just say that so far everything is going according to plan".
12511.content:
With her free hand, Daisy removes her hair?! Wait, that isn't hair at all, but a wig instead. Wait just one minute, it can't be! How could you not have seen it sooner!

"I must admit, I'm a little offended, Jack", the now familiar figure with black hair announces this time in a quieter tone, "I thought your keen sixth sense you keep babbling on about would have snuffed me out".

"97", you respond in awe, "what are you doing here"?

You have know Agent 97 for quite some time, longer than you can remember as a matter of fact, yet you didn't even know her real name (unless of course it really was 97, but I don't think the odds of that are too good).

"Why looking after you, of course", 97 replies, wiggling her fingers a bit to make you uncomfortable.

"Now come on, cut that out", you reply hastily, to which 97 listens. You now pace back and forth in 97's flat palm. "So you were here to back me up", you ask 97.

Obviously tired of laying down, 97 moves her body so that she is in a sitting position. 97 also raises you to her face, the elevation chage causing you to fall over. 97 lets out a small laugh at your mishap, which she quickly retracts when she sees the less than amused look on you face.

"Well, not exactly..." 97 trails off for a moment.
12511.title: A familiar face.

choices: She tells you all about it
You are interrupted by a knock at the door
125111.content:
"Oh, really? What's so important about your mission that they couldn't inform me of your presence?" you balk, hurt to find yourself on the outside, as if you were a rookie agent all over again.

"Hahaha!" The giant double agent rumbles, amused by your obliviousness to the new facts. She wiggles her fingers just a bit to remind you, nearly sending you sprawling to your knees. "Sometimes expertise like yours is best suited for the little details, while dumb broads like myself are meant to handle the big picture."

Ack! There it is again, this beautiful woman has you backed into a very tight corner. You've never, ever imagined in your wildest dreams that you'd be in such a position with a member of the opposite sex. Her hot, candy-scented breath blows over you like a strong ocean breeze. She pulls you back from her face and lets you take in the panoramic view of her glorious body, and the even more massive room beyond.

"Well?" she thunders, snapping your attention back to a mouth that could swallow you whole. "Wouldn't you like to know your part in the grand scheme?"

"Actually, if you don't mind, all I'd like to do right now is go for a quick swim in your sweat glands. You wouldn't happen to have that remote lying around would you?" comes your sarcastic retort.

Again your world shakes as the giant beauty laughs. "You know little mouse, I may just get ahold of it later tonight, so you might want to avoid giving me ideas!" She lifts her palm high up in the air like an express elevator, leaving you trapped 100 feet above the mattress below, then brings her other hand up and motions towards you as if clicking the dreaded remote. At this size, you are truly helpless in this young woman's power. You shudder at the thought of what she could have done to you if she had been a true villain; on the other hand, who says she couldn't still do it anyway? Agent 97 brings her dainty hand back down to face level, which is still too high for comfort (even for a trained stuntman like yourself), and the vibrations of her voice bring your attention back to the immediate matter. "I'm actually here on a whim; freelance agent. Saved up my vacation time and chose to come spend it in this lovely little corner of the globe."

You have to admit, a fair bit of time had passed since you last heard her name, and you sure hope she doesn't have the impression you forgot about her, but with all the loves and losses in your life, it's hard sometimes to keep track. But that still doesn't explain one nagging question in the back of your head.

"But how did you manage to disguise yourself so well?" you ask in genuine puzzlement. "I mean, I thought something seemed familiar. Your scent, your curves... it really felt like I knew you from somewhere, but something seemed off." Waves of realization begin to spring to mind, and you choke on your words as you begin to understand the consequences. "You uhm... you seemed... well, a little bit..."

"Taller?" she finishes for you, the pitch in her voice rising with the excitement and a smile forming on her face.

"Yeah, I guess you kinda looked like it." She more than looked like it alright! Somehow a 5'1" raven-haired gymnast managed to assume the figure of a 5'10" buxom blonde supermodel. "Must have been those high heels you wore," you suggest.

Now Agent 97 is giggling as she lowers you to the mattress, letting you step off onto the flexible surface. Before you can adjust to the new environs, you fall backwards as two dainty pedicured feet the size of buses come sliding towards you. As you regain your composure, you find yourself standing between the heels of her elegant sandals, two white columns as tall and thick as yourself!

"These little things? I know they must seem humongous to you, but believe me they only make a few inches of difference, not much compared to the rest." She stretches her feet out on either side, dwarfing you with their length as if to emphasize her point. "You see, I'm looking for some friends, went missing around here over a year ago. They wouldn't give me exact details, but I know they were seeking specific info on Dr. Salisbury or one of his associates. Probably had something to do with what you just saw half an hour ago."

"So knowing that his men know who you are, and everyone else at MI6 thanks to that treacherous rogue Agent 54, you had to come up with a persona that even your mother wouldn't recognize," you continue, playing your favorite game of constructing the answer even as it's explained to you.

"And so I grew," she finishes, putting special emphasis on the last word as she smiles at you like a giddy schoolgirl.

"The same way I shrunk?" Quite to the contrary of your erstwhile partner, you find it hard to complete your sentence, to finally acknowledge to her and to the world that you have become small and weak.

"Not exactly. You got hit by the shrinking beam. I exposed myself to the other one, so for me there's mostly nowhere to go but up. I couldn't imagine someone carrying around a remote right now that could make me atomic size on a whim, but that's the difference not getting caught makes I guess." You gaze upon the sandaled feet still surrounding you, imagining them expand even further before your eyes to the tremendous proportions they would have assumed not so long ago.

"So can't you just keep growing and take this place over?" Boy, this conversation is getting more and more awkward for you by the second!

"Darling, if I could, I would have ground this whole place to dust in a microsecond." Agent 97 blushes, then corrects herself: "Er, only after they kindly released my friends of course. I do have the remote to control my own size, but there's another miniscule problem. The process hasn't been perfected yet, and I've only made it up to about 10 ft. That's a great height to be and all, but it won't get us very far in a place like this."

"I guess then you're going to need my help after all," you chirp up enthusiastically, hoping your embarassment will be over soon and you'll be back in action at a more familiar scale. Your hopes are quickly drowned however when she communicates the next phase of her plan. "A ray of virtually unlimited size might be just around the corner, so if Harry gets it done, then I'm going to need to use your predicament to my advantage. I know, Jack, you'll be eager to help me out, do what little you can to save the world." Drat.

Without warning, like some sort of rag doll, you are swept up in Agent 97's gargantuan fingers, which wrap around you like a warm, impenetrable coccoon and leave you to lie helplessly in her grasp. Bringing you before her monstrous yet graceful lips, she blows you a kiss and smiles at you as if she were a loving goddess.

Caving in, you decide to humor your partner/occasional lover, as it seems she's destined to have her way with you in the end regardless. "So tell me, my dear 97, what's it like to be made so big and mighty, even as others dwindle before your very gaze?"

"Well for starters, little Jack, why don't you call me Sherry?"
125111.title: Something Still Doesn't Add Up

choices: 97 pretends you are dead
97 grows to ten feet tall and attacks
1251112.content:
"Sure, Sherry," you say, but before any further discourse can be had, a cacophonous knocking rocks your world. Ninety-seven darts to her feet, dropping you back to the bed, where a casual observer would not be able to distinguish your diminished form.

She has no time to answer the intruder at the door before it is thrust open, and a looming giant - scarred and bald, savage despite his sharp suit - is backlit. "The boss," he slurs, "wants to know if you're finished with the shrimp."

You wonder what your ally's reaction will be. Will she play along, and confirm your demise, or use this as an opportunity to increase her size and combat the big lug?
1251112.title: You are interrupted by a knock at the door

choices: She goes back to Harold, so he won't suspect anything.
She starts to look around for her captured friends.
12511122.content:
"Yes, yes, I'm finished with him", she says, "He's over there", she says, pointing at the bed.

The hulking man starts to walk towards the bed, and his looming form towers over you. "What is she doing?", you think as you suddenly see a flash of orange light just behind him. He turns around, just to be face to "*face* with Sherry's crotch, as she stares down at him, her hands on her hips.

"What the...?", the guy barely manages to say, just as she swiftly gives him a sucker puch, making him spin around a little. She then finishes him with a rabbit punch, landing just between his neck and his skull. The blow knocks the guy down, unconscious. Sherry then stamps her foot on his back, as if to hold him there in case he tried to stand up again.

"Oh, boy...", you say, your mouth hanging open as the amazonic woman in front of you beats the big guy so easily and quickly. "I see you're also very skilled at hand to hand combat, huh?".
"Well, I just can't let you out of my sight right now", she says as she walks towards the bed, crouching to get a better look at you. "But we have to hurry now", she says, placing her open palm right next to you. You back away a little, startled at the sight of a 25' (for you) long hand.

"Hurry! We don't have much time!", she says, her voice thundering inside your ears. You immediately obey and hop on her hand. She lifts it quickly, making you fall down again. Then the orange flash appears again, shrinking her back to her former 5'10''. The sudden change of her hands size makes you a little dizzy again, while she swiftly puts her wig on again.

"OK, OK, hold on", she says, as she closes her hand, trapping you inside her fist before you can even respond. She then walks out of the room.
12511122.title: Amazon 97

choices: Harold takes her to bed for happy 'dead nemesis' sex
Harold takes her to the launch site of his super-weapon
125111221.content:
You can make out little of the world around you, trapped as you are within Agent 97's sweaty fist. You're sure she doesn't mean anything by it, but she can't control herself. This is risky business, no two ways about it, and even you'd have trouble keeping your cool when facing down such a dangerous man.

She talks, and while you cannot make out the meaning of the words, you can hear someone reply. Harold, presumably? Is he curious about your potential demise, eager to exult in the final defeat of his long-time nemesis? It's agony, not knowing how the mission is progressing, having the course of events utterly out of your hands. You'll just have to trust that 97 has a plan.
125111221.title: She goes back to Harold

choices: Make a run for the mouse hole.
Go into the aquarium and wait for a better opportunity to escape.
12512.content:
"Alright," Daisy says very slowly and very deliberately as she places you on the nearby nightstand. "Now you'll do exactly what I tell you. Understood?"

Surprised, you look up into her huge face and instead of it smiling in that stupid idiotic way, it's very menacing.

Eyes narrowed, she grins wickedly. "If you really want to live past the next hour, you'd better obey me."

"I thought Harold was to be my employer."

"Ha! That bumbling fool. He thinks all women are mindless idiots. If one's smart enough to play stupid, one survives. If not, well...?"

"But wasn't he the one who shrunk me?"

"Take one guess who had to hold his hand as he 'invented' it. And then swallow her pride as he gloats over it like a pig to his 'business associates'. As long as I stroke his over-sized ego, I'll be fine."

"So..."

"So, are you going to obey my every command or shall I just feed you to the pet cat now?"

You shake your head in vain hopes of clearing it. Not only from the shrink ray after effects but also by the sudden turn of events.

A minute passes and you conclude you've been forced to jump from the frying pan into the fire. However, given the circumstances, you have little choice.

You throw up your hands in mock surrender. "All right, I agree to work for you. At least, I won't be working for my arch nemesis, Harry. Who knows, you might be better."

She gives a thin smile. "Well, will wonders ever cease? You're the first man to actually use his brain. Even if it is literally the size of a pea."

"What do you mean? How many others have there been?"

"Too many to count. Do you really think you're safe if you co-operate?" She threw back her head and laughed.

You cringe and look around. There is a tiny mouse hole at the far end of the room. You reason that you could jump onto the bed, slide down the bedsheets to the floor, and make a run for it. The only problem is getting past Harry's white cat. It's been watching you with unnerving fascination ever since it slipped in with you and Daisy.

"Well?!" Daisy demanded.

You realize with horror that you failed to hear her first 'request'. Not exactly the best way to start off.

"Sorry. Didn't hear you."

Her eyes narrowed with suspicion. "You better do better."

You only nod.

"I said to get into my glass aquarium."

You look with horror as she points to a glass aquarium filled with weird insects. There is also a huge padlock on the secured lid. "What for," you ask her.

"That's a silly question. You're my pet. All pets belong in aquariums."

"I'll be eaten."

"Not if you keep ahead of them. Besides, as long as I feed them, they'll just be curious about you. Trust me."

"I thought I was going to be your partner."

"Partner? I never said that, you foolish boy. All I said is that if you obey my every command, you'll live."
12512.title: turn of events

choices: Turn and take the shot
Never stop running
125121.content:
"One day, all men will be as you: insects for my amusement!" Daisy laughs, before turning and scooping the cat from the floor and into her arms. This is as good a chance as you're going to get.

A flick of the knife in your sleeve and it's in your hand, slicing into the thick fabric of the silk bedsheets and allowing you to rip your way down toward the ground.

"I'm just wondering how long I should keep Harold in his deluded state. What do you think, snookums?"

Is she expecting an answer? You sure hope not, but then the cat yowls and she laughs. The floor is getting very close now...

"You're right. It'll be all the more satisfying if I shrink him right off his throne, taking his victory at the very moment of its culmination! Picture him, looking up at me as I step past him to become queen - no, god of this world! Then a little' sorry Harold' in that airhead voice before grinding him under my heel..."

Uh oh, that sounds like the end of her monologue. You've still got to run past her immense foot - the one that she's even now fantasising about using to grind a shrunken man - before you're home clear. You start running.

"No no no! What am I thinking! Of course, you can have him! The irony is too delicious! And I imagine he'll taste better than those mice you've been chewing on."

As she chats to the cat, the woman paces back a forth a little, idly moving her feet. One impacts directly behind your three-inch form, and you stumble. But no, she hasn't seen you, and that mouse hole is scant feet away. Nearly there... Once clear, you'll track down Salisbury, acquire the device, restore yourself, save the world, get the girl, quip wittily as the base explodes and be back home in time for elevenses...

"Unless you want more company in that insect pen, Sterling? Sterling?"

Her frustrated roar is accompanied by the padded impact of the cat being dropped to the floor behind you. It's bigger than an elephant right now, so you scramble to your feet and make one last dash for the hole. It's faster though, it'll catch you!

You have your pistol. You could stop, turn and take a shot. It won't kill the beast, but a hit to the eye - no problem to a marksman like you - should give it enough pause to let you get away.

Alternatively, you could keep running. You're a fit man, after all...
125121.title: Monolgue

13.content:
"You were interested in my business operations, Mister Sterling? Then follow me."

Who could refuse an offer from Dieter Halstead, one of the richest, most powerful men in the world? Certainly not someone who had been assigned to investigate rumours of his involvement in smuggling weapons-grade uranium, as you have.

So it is that you take your leave of the roulette table, following Halstead while being trailed yourself by his two minders, large men whose dinner jackets strain at the seams at their bulk.

Your own clothes fit you perfectly, earning you many a glance from the ladies frequenting the casino as you make your way to the private rooms at the back. Halstead opens the door and beckons you in.

You smile at the man, meeting his serpent gaze steadily as you walk past him into the room. You're inviting a lot of danger here; the possibility that he's merely taking you to one side to have you killed has entered your mind more than once. But you are confident of your ability to get out of this situation. A lot more confident than you are in the cover identity cooked up for you by Control.

You are surprised by the sparseness of the chamber that you find yourself in. Compared to the decadent opulence of the Monte Carlo casino outside, it is a run-down dive. A single table sits in the centre of the room, with but a single chair.

"Welcome to my place of business," Halstead chuckles.

Your instincts were right - it's a trap! You're already reaching your hand towards your hidden pistol when Halstead dismisses his guards, leaving the two of you alone in the room, door closed.

"It is necessary to go undetected, of course, so my office and transportation facilities are one and the same," Halstead says, fiddling with a hidden catch on the table. His words aren't making any sense, but you listen anyway, sure that the madman is about to explain his plan; they always do, in your experience.

Then there is a click. You reach for your gun, but too late. A yellow glow envelops both you and Halstead, and to your embarassment you pass out.

***

You awaken to find Halstead taking you by the hand, helping you to your feet.

"It always affects people like that the first time," he says, with a jovial familiarity that you don't care for.

"What the devil was that?" you enquire of him, and he laughs.

"The best way to hide the location of my enterprises is in plain sight," he says, pointing.

You follow his arm and finger, and see that a large, two-storey building lies just some distance away, across an expanse of strangely coloured grass.

It is the grass that really confuses you; it's red, almost the same shade as the carpet of the room you were in when you passed out...

No, it is exactly the same colour. The grass is the carpet, but now it reaches almost to your waist.

You cast your gaze upwards, and see that the shade in which you rest is caused by a monumental structure, one supported by four mighty pillars.

It's the table.

Somehow, you've been shrunk. You turn to Halstead, but he merely smiles again.

"Ingenious, isn't it? Of course, we downsize a lot more in transit, so that the whole operation can be carried through customs with no problems, but in these circumstances I thought it best to start you off easy."
13.title: Casino Small

choices: Meet the mule
See the storage facility
You have something else in mind
131.content:
"But come, we shall discuss matters in more comfortable surroundings."

You follow Halstead to the tiny building, sleek in appearance as any office building, shining and multi-edged like a vast jewel.

The interior is as swish as any other villain's lair you've visited in the past. Henchman scurry hither and thither, carrying packages that can contain nothing less than the missing uranium.

A large man joins Dieter, dressed in a suit so sharp you could cut yourself on it.

"Ah, I don't believe you know Mister Slice," Halstead introduces.

Of course. The obligatory sillily-named bodyguard. The one fragment that was missing.

"As you can see, this whole facility is custom-built for the purpose of transportation. The mule that carries our cargo varies from journey to journey - often because I forcibly 'retire' them afterwards, to cover the trail - but this place is eternal, the one consistent cog that your donation will go towards maintaining. Once you get a piece of this action, I guarantee that you will see it pay off."

"Laying the salesman routine on a little thick."

"Oh, I am sorry. I should probably show you a little more before I pump you for cash. So, what shall it be: do you want to meet today's mule, or would you rather inspect the storage facility?"
131.title: Who Would Live...

choices: Try to escape to alert Sasha
Stay put; she's a big girl, and can take care of herself
1311.content:
"As you wish. I believe we've outstayed our welcome here anyway," Halstead says, his eyes flickering across to a bank of monitors dominating one wall. You follow his gaze, and see something of a ruckus ensuing in the casino outside, with irate gamblers attacking dealers.

"They do so hate it when I take their money," Halstead continues, grinning wolfishly. "Still, they'll find it quite impossible to locate me now. Lock the building down, Mister Slice."

The henchman grunts assent before shuffling off, gesturing to other minions and speaking into a radio headset.

"Look there," Halstead says, pointing at one screen in particular. You focus, spotting the beautiful woman that stands calm in the midst of the storm. A pale dress sets off her dark skin wonderfully, and the slight smile that she displays at the chaos erupting around her has you entranced. You can only just make out Halstead's words as your eyes drink up every one of her movements.

"By working for me, Sasha hopes to make enough money to hire some top-shot lawyer to free her brother. Not bloody likely, mind you - I had him framed in place of one of my own agents. The irony of having her work for me was just too delicious to pass up on.

"Of course, she has no inkling of exactly what's in the tiny package that she'll be smuggling, and that's for the best; as soon as this facility has been transferred to more trustworthy hands, I'll be having her arrested for drugs trafficking. She'll join her brother soon enough."

The fiend! You've only known her a few moments - and the definition of 'known' in this instance is watching her on a camera - but you can't let the villain use her in this way! You have to warn her!

Easier said than done, mind. Leaving aside the fact that you're marginally bigger than a speck of dust at the moment, there's also the matter of the lockdown that Mister Slice is instigating. You'd have to get past him to get outside in the first place!

Then there's the small matter of jeopardising your mission for a pretty face. You've been warned about it before. Better to stay here and properly observe Halstead's operation, possibly taking a chance to find out how he's communicating with the outside world and perhaps hijack it at some point to talk with Sasha. There's no guarantee that that chance may ever arise however, and so you could be abandoning her to her fate if you don;t take a chance now.
1311.title: Sasha, Unwitting Dupe

choices: Halstead's mule is picking the facility up
There's a police raid on the casino; quite a shake-up
The shrinking process has unforseen side-effects...
1312.content:
"Of course. How could you trust my business venture if you did not see that your merchandise was being well taken care of? Mister Slice, if you would be so good as to lead the way..."

The henchman grunts, and you wonder how much the hulking brute has in common with humanity's primitive ancestors.

The walk is an exhaustive one, though labyrinthine corridors that descend into the bowels of the complex, boiler-suited flunkies at every junction and doorway. No wonder Halstead chose to downsize his operations in this way; were this building to be 1:1 scale it would be one of the wonders of the world!

Then you're arrived. The storage facility stretches back a considerable distance, and even though its silo'd bays are mostly empty, each of the dozen could hold several missiles. Looking down from the handrailed walkway, the nearest is loaded with crates.

"Finest cocaine," Halstead says. "But we offer services to all businessmen. Weapons, drugs, personnel, slaves... We don't discriminate here."

"Good to hear," you mumble, absently snapping photographs with the camera concealed within your collar.

"You seem distracted..." Halstead says, and you are halfway through concocting a cover story when the earthquakes begin.
1312.title: Storage Facility

choices: You awaken inside a metal cage somewhere very unfamiliar.
You awaken outside, discarded to die atop a barrel of garbage.
You awaken full-size, outside a police station and framed for a crime
132.content:
"As you can must certainly know by now, Mister Sterling," he spreads his arms in wide grandeur, "we have been miniaturized! An ingenious solution invented by my own mind and my many millions, all for the purpose of making mayhem and many more millions!" Halstead slows his train, "But please excuse me, this is not about me or my money. This is about you, my good friend, Mister Sterling."

The more he talks, the more lightheaded you feel. He urges you to follow behind him, but your feet disagree, stumbling from side to side. Halstead talks on, "You must understand the trouble, the irritation, international laws present to proud men such as ourselves," and on more, "No doubt, you, yourself have clever ways to dodge the customs bullet, so to speak," and on still, "though none nearly as cunning as mine, but there I go on again about myself."

The spinning of your head is worse now than when in the hypnotist's torture chamber and even worse than the martini drinking marathon you endured to rescue that foreign princess. Yes, Jack Sterling truly is man of a million victories, though this one seems to be slipping from you as you begin blinking erratically. Your host turns, grinning at sight of your staggering, shuffling strides, "Ah, I see I've no need to pretend much longer."

"What have you done, Dieter?" you choke out, reaching out futilely for his blurring visage. "What is happening to me?"

He laughs, "Nothing at all Mister Sterling. I did tell you everyone is affected this way the first time." His cloudy shape steps casually from your vision as you collapse to one knee. "But," Halstead states note, "I have a feeling your first time may be your last, Agent Jack Sterling!" You scoff at his minor discovery. "That is right! Your name is well known to all men of wealth and power like myself!"

"Perhaps I am a different Jack Sterling," you remark with a pulsing pain in your chest.

"And you would have me believe that? You are far more foolish than you are credited, Sterling. And soon you will never be a bother to me or any tyrannical entrepreneur again!" Halstead's laugh echoes between your ears as you once again pass into numb darkness, lying helpless among the red grain of a madman's carpet.
132.title: No Hiding from Your Name

Your cage is not hanging from the ceiling, but from an earlobe...
1321.content:
Your mouth is numb with bile as you slackly work it open to release a groan. Your eyes peel themselves next, and you shake your head to clear the vision from double to single.

He suckered you but good.

It seems as if you're in a cage of some sort. It doesn't take someone with your astute levels of awareness to realise this as you grasp the metal bars with your hands, feeling no give whatsoever in them. Beyond, the landscape is unfamiliar, shapes seeming to resemble recognisable objects, but with a wrongness to them. The floor drops away beyond the limits of your rectangular prison, and it's quite a drop should you even manage to figure out a way outside.

Your cage must be suspended from the ceiling, but is too heavy for you to get swinging, no matter how much you try to rock the structure with shifting weight. Halstead has quite the arrangement here. Clearly, you're going to have to wait for him to explain his plan and try to kill you before you can escape this time.

Then you are alerted to the presence of another human being, and your situation becomes clear.
1321.title: Inside a Metal Cage

choices: It's time for your obedience training
It's time for her aerobic workout
13212.content:
Suddenly your eyes begin to focus and you start to realise what's in the room outside your cage. Below you is a huge brown wooden surface with large bottles and a gigantic laptop and across from you is an enormous double-bed with a pink bedspread and a large cuddly toy puppy. And next to the bed seems to be a massive door. This is obviously a bedroom.

Just as you try to think further, the door opens and in walks a girl in her late teens. Long toned legs stretch up to her denim shorts and a tight t-shirt clings around her huge bosom. She has long brown hair, a beautiful smiling face and, from your perspective, she seems to be at least fifty foot tall.

She approaches your cage and peers in. When she sees you are awake, she grins to herself, easily flips open the cage door and lifts you out. She sets you in her palm and begins to stroke you gently from the back of your head to your bottom with her index finger cooing as if you were a kitten.

"You're so cute, yes you are". She murmurs.

Struggling in vain to fend off her petting, you look up at her and beg her to let you go.

She giggles at you. "Let you go? I own you now, you silly little man."

"Own me?" you gasp.

"Yes, own you. And you should be thanking me, not complaining. Daddy was going to kill you but I convinced him to give you to me as a pet. So your life is mine now." She squeals with delight. "And I can't get over how cute you are."

Suddenly you realise this must be Lena Halstead, Dieter's daughter. You cringe to yourself as you realise you are now so insignificant to your nemesis has given you away as a pet.

"Now then," Lena muses to herself out loud, "I can't stand here petting the little man all day. I've got work to do."
13212.title: Your enemy's daughter's pet.

choices: She returns later with a reward of food to reward your good behaviour.
She returns later with a new accessory for your cage.
132121.content:
She lifts you up to her face so that your eyes meet.
