143211.title: "A little, yes.", she answers.

choices: "So, what's with the bouquet?", you ask her, noticing her flowers.
Someone approaches you.
1432111.content:
As you tell the tale, explaining how you ended up the size of a small mouse, in Paris, and on her open palm, you can't help but notice the expression on her face change accordingly. At the beginning of your tale, she seems quite skeptical; then, her eyes show a bit of curiosity and interest, and finally, her face shows the unmistakable features of amusement and excitement.


"So you're a spy!", she says, a little too loud. "Mon Dieu! Un petit espion! Vraiment formidable!"

"Yes, well, anyway, since you happened to found me, now I need your help.",you continue, trying to sound serious.

"Help you?", she said, frowning a little. "Well, sure. But how could I possibly help you?"

"Just do as I say, and everything should be fine, OK?"

"Sure, sure!", she says, now even more excited. "I always wanted to be a secret spy!"


You're about to correct her, but you stop yourself. It's better to keep her happy, and if she wants to play spy, then so be it. You use your left hand to hold to her thumb, since all this excitement is causing her to shake her hand a little.


"By the way", she says. "What's your name?"

"Sterling", you answer. "Jack Sterling. May I ask yours, mademoiselle?"

"Legrand", she replies, grinning. "Mélanie Legrand." She makes a small pause. "Secret Agent Legrand. I like the sound of it."
1432111.title: Moi, l'espion.

choices: It is her friend
It is an agent
14321111.content:
"These? They are to be a gift. I am waiting for a friend."

"I'm afraid you'll have to postpone your get-together. My mission will take priority, and I already have a rendez-vous set up for only a few hour's time..."

It is only when you look up from your watch that you notice the glare on Mélanie's huge face. She does not seem impressed by your demanding schedule.

"Oh, for one so small to be in such a rush! You are in Paris, and there is always time to relax! Now shush - I will endeavour to help you once my friend and I have become re-acquainted. Until then, you may rest in... Hmm, let me see..."

She begins to rummage in her bag with her free hand, meaning that you are the first to notice the approaching figure, a shadow that blots out the sun.
14321111.title: Flowers For...

choices: She tries to stamp on you.
She screams in a girly way and climbs up the fountain.
14323.content:
Knowing some French yourself, you immediately understand what that meant, which makes you shiver. She thinks you're a mouse! Her blue eyes keep looking down at you, but you can't exactly determine what her intentions are now. Should you run? Should you try to talk to her?

Before you can decide, however, she makes the choice for you...
14323.title: 'Une souris!'

choices: Stay here and wait for someone else to arrive
Scuttle off to hide
143232.content:
The shriek is deafening, but as the colossal woman climbs the fountain, you sigh in relief. If she'd had a mind to, she could have crushed you. How foolish those people, scared of something so much weaker than themselves...

Still, the show she's putting on could well draw unwelcome attention, or it could bring Agent Petit out of hiding. Sticking here for the fallout is tempting, but maybe you should scamper somewhere to hide?
143232.title: Thomas!

choices: Wait it out
Dash for freedom
Try and cause a distraction
144.content:
No time for further thought as feet crunch closer, and voices a vast distance above your huddled half-inch form begin a discussion. Behind the pile of rubbish you assume that they can't see you, otherwise the talk would be taking a decidedly different tack...

"He can't have just disappeared!"

"I saw him run this way. And he's not here."

"A fire escape-?"

"Don't be daft. No one's that fast. Perhaps the manhole..."

While your two pursuers discuss your fate, you ponder which way would be the best to get away. You most certainly don't want to get into a gunfight with these guys now! Two full clips, but your bullets would do little more than annoy these guys.

You could wait it out, hoping that low-ranking dupes like the two knuckleheads haven't been informed of the watch's shrinking properties. They'll leave eventually, and you can proceed on your next course of action then. If they do know that you may be shrunken though, then that would be a bad thing to do.

You could dash away instead, hoping that they wouldn't notice, but again, if they do...
144.title: Knuckleheads

choices: Sneak a lift with the giants
Strike out on your own
1441.content:
The time grates, but not as much as the sound of the two giants lifting the manhole cover.

"Bah. No way am I goin' down there..." one says.

"Hey, if he went, we follow."

"He didn't go down there. If he'da used this ladder, he'd surely have left a trail through the goop."

"You're right. Still, I don't think that the boss is gonna be happy when we report back that we lost him."

"Hey, we got plenty of time to think up excuses before we get back to the base, dude."

They're heading back to their hideout! Perhaps you should tag along with them, to find out who's behind this whole caper, even though taking the watch to them may not be well advised.

Or you could carry through with your original scheme, waiting until they've exited before trying to get back to your own headquarters.
1441.title: The Goon Squad

choices: Hitch a lift with the biker
Observe for now
Explore Vencie
1442.content:
You run, faster than you've ever run before, knowing that one step from either of those goons is more than enough to cover a full minute of your best sprinting. Your only real hope is that they don't notice you, since you couldn't possibly hope to outdistance them.

Still, passing through a gap in the wire-link fence blocking one end of the alley is an advantage of your new size, as the structure should prove quite an obstacle to two regular-sized people.

Once out into the sunlight of the Venetian streets, you look around for something, anything, to give an indication of a direction to go. Houses line your view, soaring to impossible heights, and the road is deserted.

A screeching, roaring thunder pervades your senses, and as you grind your eyes shut and cover your ears it stops. Looking around again, you see that you are in the shadow of something. And casting your gaze upwards shows that something to be a motorbike or scooter, its front wheel bigger than the London Eye.

A foot topples from the heavens, clad in a stylish black leather woman's boot, thundding to the ground inches from you and indicating that the rider intends to stop here. When no further dismount occurs, you conclude that this woman must be waiting for something, and allow yourself to look up the expanse of her leather-clad leg. Not bad.

Maybe you should tag along with her, hitching a ride on something fast enough to get you well away from here. But you don't know why she's here; she may even be in cahoots with the two men even now searching for you! You could observe for a while just to see if this is true or not, but wasting such time may allow her to drive off and leave you behind if she is innocent.

Perhaps you should ignore her entirely, and go looking elsewhere.
1442.title: Dash for Freedom

choices: The rats run in your direction
An alley-cat sees you and springs
The men ignore the animals
1443.content:
Your pistol may not bother the two gargantuan goons before you, but there must be plenty of others that would - aha!

Rooting around some of the garbage deposited in this alleyway, you spot a small cluster of rats. They're fierce creatures now, approaching elephantine size to you, but a good shot ought to startle them, get them running, making a noise to occupy your pursuers while you get away.

It's hardly a challenging shot, either. You take the monster in the back right hip, and it squeaks with a fury that you wouldn't like to see up close, alarming its pack-mates and stirring up quite the commotion.

Now's your chance!
1443.title: Rat

choices: Life. Sharinku's lady will retrieve you, and you will foil his scheme!
Death. Jack Sterling is a man of brave daring and fears nothing!
145.content:
A wild parasol dances along alone with the cool morning breeze, a multi-hued parachute to a person your size. You let it pass by peacefully as you walk to the awaiting adventure in the Land of the Rising Sun. Sometimes the freelance secret agent business affords you the opportunity to get out and see the world, though such pleasant sights are rarely seen between gunplay and intrigue as this glorious sun dawning over the horizon of seemingly endless Tokyo road. You take temporary shelter beneath a dew-sparkling bush and breath in its sweet scent as the golden orb rises.

Lights in surrounding buildings click on, windowshades roll open, the thousand eyes of each living structure gradually come alive with lamplight. Illumination growing brighter, you notice the colorful signs holding tight along the heights of shops down this infinite path. Time passes slowly, soothingly. Some early risers exit home and ride or stride here and there but never dangerously near you. It all seems so clean and organized, you almost forget you are, in unreal actuality, sitting beneath the damp leaves of an immensely large plant.

A familiar beep sounds from your wrist, but you react with your knowledge this time to something very different. The once black face of the watch has morphed into the face of a grinning, wild-haired man. "Sharinku!" You exclaim, much to his satisfaction.

"That is correct, Jack Sterling!" the flat image responds with a cackle. "It is I, the Great Sharinku! The master of molecular manipulation and soon to be ruler of this little world!" He laughs again, placing a black top-hat upon his head and spinning around in frenzy. "You have fallen right into my trap! How perfect this is! Hahaha-hehe!"

The dignity and honor and promise of this day seems to decline with each word Sharinku speaks. You respond sharply, "What kind of nonsense is this Sharinku!? What are you planning in that skewed mind of yours?" You're unsure if he can see your confidently focused face, but he sure enough hears your defiant words.

Sharinku giggles quietly but quickly silences himself. "It's not that easy, Jack! In your foolishness, you have proven the point! Given me the result! I will succeed!" He roars right back into his savage laughter then becomes strikingly serious, his whole persona shifting to the somber, "But as for you, you can live or you can die. You have played your part."

"I have played my part!?" you yell, almost biting down on the watch, its proximity to your mouth nearer than your lips. "What do you mean, Sharinku, you madman!?" Sharinku lowers his head, remaining solemn. "I have sent a female associate of mine to bring you back here. I would like very much for you to be a part of my collection." You are stunned and confused beyond words only to be startled as Sharinku springs back to life, "But if you'd prefer, Jack, you can take your chances out there!" He points off screen to a road he can't possibly see, but still your eyes follow his to it. "It is life or death, Jack!"

The screen again goes black, leaving you once again in peace as people steadily grow more plentiful all around you. "It's life or death, Jack," you repeat, "life or death. We shall see about that! We shall see."
145.title: The Rising Sun

choices: It is a stampede of Japanese schoolgirls
It is a tired-looking salary man
It is a tourist, up bright and early to explore the city
1452.content:
You'll be damned if you're going to sit around and play Sharinku's games. You estimate that you'll have a few minutes before his minion shows up, so you'd best make the most of them. At your present scale, you're not going to cover much ground.

Crossing the road would be death, so you stick to the sidewalk, keeping close to the wall to avoid any intrusive feet that may step upon you.

You try to suppress your sense of wonder, but you cannot help gawking at the massive structures that you pass by. Getting along in this world of giants will not be easy.

The object dominating the skyline before you must be a bus shelter, you surmise. Perhaps that would be a good place to halt, to get your bearings and perhaps attain some faster method of transportation.

You approach the hut, finding gaps easily small enough for your body to squeeze through. As you enter, a tumultuous cacophony can only herald the approach of some regular-sized people, each a monster to you now. You cower at your first opportunity to witness a giant up close.
1452.title: Bus Stop

choices: Sneak along with one of the girls
Maintain an independent operation
14521.content:
The thunder gets louder and louder, as more and more people enter the bus-stop. They practically fill the bus stop, and never have you been more in fear for your life.

Each foot is clad in a glossy black shoe, well polished and topped with a knee-high - so far above you now, swaying like a tall tree - white socks that give way to expanses of bare flesh before a skirt swallows them in shadow. Clean white shirts top the ensemble, and even before you - neck fully craned back to stare up at the top of the ambulatory skyscrapers - spot the bright neck-ties you've discerned that these are schoolgirls. The age you're not entirely sure of, but in the present circumstances that's the least of your worries.

A few plomp themselves down upon the seats with a crack of absolute sound that momentarily blanks your senses. Those that remain standing don't exactly keep still, so your combat relexes are on hold as they shift from foot to foot and you prepare to leap for your life at any given moment.

Still, these giants do present an opportunity for you to get out of here. Were you to hide yourself among their possessions - say, like that pink handbag that one has placed on the ground - then your bid to escape from Sharinku would be greatly aided.

Of course, there's an inherent danger in that plan as well, so perhaps it would be best to hide for the time being and make your own way onto the bus.
14521.title: Not Much Elbow Room

choices: Keep quiet and await the journey
Risk contacting the outside world
145211.content:
You need to cover lots of ground fast, and so you need access to a longer pair of legs.

No time is wasted inspecting the many various bags, you merely select the closest one to you and set to climbing it.

Its pink surface feels very tacky to your hands, certainly made from some weird new substance rather than a traditional textile. You can't believe that you're having to focus all your climbing skills in scaling a school girl's handbag!

Regardless, you reach the top to find it open, and descend just as smartly and stealthily into the shadowy pit, where a colossal mobile 'phone sits among a parade of other similarly outsize knick-knacks, from tissues to fluffy mascots.

The telephone could be your ticket out of here; you have enough spy gear and technical know-how to be able to co-opt its signal for your own uses, and contact home base for help. The only drawback would be that the girl to whom this bag belongs may hear your conversation - or at least the other side of it - and interrupt you halfway. perhaps it would be best just to settle for her acting as transport.

Then again, he who dares wins, right..?
145211.title: Cellphone Temptation

choices: You start up the engine and get driving
You step out of the car to see what's what
The car you were chasing pulls up
Another vehicle drives up - a BIG one
A seeming giant walks by
15.content:
Your car careens through the garbage blocking your path, scattering it behind you. If they thought that they could lose you by driving down this narrow alley, they were sorely mistaken. You've never been thrown off a car chase yet, and you're not about to start now. Even the prospect of dirtying up the car doesn't concern you too much; it just means that the men you're chasing will be in a lot more trouble when you finally catch them.

Two low-level nobodies in the service of a crime syndicate made up of former KGB agents. You're only after them because they can lead you to someone bigger, someone with real knowledge about what's being done with the secret weapon files that someone stole from the Kremlin.

Just another day at work.

Ahead of you, their car crunches back onto the main street, forcing other motorists to swerve aside or risk a collision. You follow in their wake, expertly remaining almost exactly within their tyre prints. Once you've gotten a little further away from this built-up urban area, you can bring out the big guns. Until then, you'll have to play it cool.

As a shot ricochets off your right wing mirror, you realise that they have no such qualms about keeping this business quiet. One of them is leaning out of the window, plugging away madly with a kolasnikov.

Well, they can't blame you now - it was they that upped the stakes first. You reach for the secret console hidden behind the dashboard, but pull your finger away when you have to follow them around another tight bend. Seems that they're heading for that big industrial plant ahead; why would that be?

Then a strange glow covers your car. Some sort of weapon fired from the car ahead? No, they seem to be affected as well. You have no idea where it is coming from, but it seems to be having a soporific effect...

***

You awaken to find your head buried in the air-bag of your car. Unsurprisingly, you lost control when you passed out.

Fighting free, you take a look outside. It's gotten dark, so you must have been out a while. You get the feeling that maybe you have lost your first car chase...
15.title: The Side Streets

choices: Press onwards!
Crawl away...
Look for local help
151.content:
Well, you've no time to be sitting around. Best to be on your way, and hope that the trail hasn't gone entirely cold.

You restart your vehicle, and coax the car down the road. Oddly, the surface seems a lot more uneven than it was a moment ago. Also, a lot wider, and with much higher pavement curbs...

It doesn't take long for your sharpened intellect to conclude that you have been reduced in size. You are now driving a bloody matchbox car.

You hurridly pull in to the side to get out of the line of fire, so to speak. You would hate to be crushed underneath a tyre; such a demeaning way to die for someone of your long career.

So, you have two choices, since the road runs in two directions. Either you carry on ahead, hoping to conclude the mission regardless of circumstances, or you turn around and head for home, looking for a cure.

They'll understand.

Of course, there's also the third option: to get out of the road entirely and wait around for a passer-by, and attempt to enlist their aid.
151.title: Matchbox

choices: Take a rest break
Press on regardless, awaiting a sign
Allow your car to be pulled along by one of the larger vehicles
1511.content:
Peddle down, you power into the night, maximum speed accelerating you almost to the pace of the domineering giant cars that pass you regularly.

So fearsome! Each mechanical montrosity towers far above you like some futuristic space station brought to earth, and each time their wake hits you you're forced to scramble desperately to prevent your vehicle from being dragged along by their currents.

To make matters worse, you're not entirely sure where you are. Street signs are sort of hard to read from this angle, and the GPS seems to have shorted out in the process of being shrunk. Maybe you should abandon your vehicle and climb to the pavement to get your bearings...
1511.title: I Hate Driving In My Car

choices: You contact HQ
There's no signal
You cut into the KGB frequency
1512.content:
Your training doesn't cover this level of insanity. The only hope you have is to get back to base and hope that the boys in the lab can figure out what's up with you. It isn't as if you can continue to follow the trail of the men you were after in any case, as every second puts them further from you than your car can cover in a minute.

It still feels rotten in your gut, a punch to everything you stand for, to let them get away, but you know that you have no choice. Spinning the wheel in your hands, you abruptly bring your car around one-eighty and speed off home.

At least, you hope that that's the way you're headed; at this scale, you're not too confident of exactly where within the city you are, and getting lost will eat hours into your journey.

Luckily, you do still have your radio within the car. You zap it on and hope that the miniaturisation process hasn't shorted it out or something.
1512.title: One-Eighty

choices: Follow the drunk
Escape from the roadway
Check out your crushed vehicle
152.content:
This bears closer investigation. You exit your vehicle, pacing around in darkness until you activate the torch concealed within your cufflink.

Playing the beam of light about, you get a better impression of your surroundings. The ground is uneven, pocked and pitted by enormous impacts sometime in the past, and in the distance you can make out a sheer wall that towers some thirty feet into the air. In every other direction you can make out nothing, so you move closer to the wall to see if there's any way to scale it and thus gain a better view of the area.

As you get closer, you notice a large mound resting near the wall, and divert your journey appropriately.

It is bigger than your car, but sits in an ungainly heap, angles sitting in strange ways, as if crushed and distorted. You notice what looks like a logo, only the punishment that has been dealt makes it almost illegible. It's in Russian, but that is but one of many languages which you can speak.

It's a warning of some sort, mentioning that the danger of death may arise from smoking...

Oh, no. It's an empty cigarette packet, crushed and discarded by the side of the road! You haven't gone anywhere at all - instead you've shrunk somehow!

Then you hear a rumbling noise, and turn around just in time to see your car die. A colossal foot descends from the heavens (stepping off the curb) to impact on it, smashing it flat instantly. Another falls beside it, and the giant stumbles slowly across the road, walking haphazardly, as if drunk. You can make out little detail, and are too awed by the size to do anything but gape.

Maybe you should try and make contact with him or her, despite their inebriated state. They may be able to help you.

Or you could continue with your original plan to climb out of the road, and then try to find assistance elsewhere.

Finally, you could run to your car to see what gadgets inside may still be salvageable.
152.title: Crushed

choices: Climb into a pocket
Wave your hands to get the drunk's attention
Shoot a tiny, harmless bullet into the drunk
1521.content:
The meandering steps of the drunken giant aren't hard to follow, but do require you to keep your distance lest he or she step backward and crush you underheel.

Then the impossible happens, as the titan drops their impressive mass to all fours and heaves up a surging fall of vomit from the mouth, washing to the road surface with a tremendous gush.

This might be your chance - you could make for a pocket of the person's trousers and stow away for some convenient transport, or else you run to their now-nearer-the-ground face and try to get some attention!

But perhaps that's too passive for an agent of your calibre. Maybe you should draw your trusty sidearm and put a bullet into this drunkard, to show them who's boss. At your new scale it shouldn't do them any serious injury - barely more than a pin-prick, really - but it might serve to sober them up a little.
1521.title: Vomit

choices: You stand on your car to be noticed
You flee while the drunk is distracted
A full-size car pulls up near the drunk
1523.content:
Your vehicle did not take the impact of a giant foot very well. Clearly, being reduced in size has altered the composition of the materials that make up its structure, as the mighty steel has crumpled like so much tinfoil.

Turning this way and that, you find it difficult to gauge a method of ingress through either door or window, so thoroughly has the car been stamped flat. And that was just an accidental step; if the giant had meant to stomp their foot down harshly, the damage would be... You daren't think what would happen if you were caught underneath such a danger!

Your awed gaping satisfied for the time being, you turn back to the drunk for an update on their progress, only to notice them lurching back toward your position, feet forced to tow the line but stumbling regardless, each lurching stomp several yards out of where you expected making you edgy, as you cannot predict where each lethal impact may land.

"Whoh wuz at I stepped on..." a thunderous voice wonders. Seems like the drunk wants to inspect the remains of your car - a chance for you to get acquainted with them, a chance for you to escape, or a chance for random happenstance to intervene...
1523.title: Check out your crushed vehicle

choices: Stick with the car
Go for the laces
15231.content:
It was thirty feet in your scale from the road surface to the top of the pavement sidewalk, so to say that the feet of the drunk are big is an understatement. Massive combat boots stride closer, untied shoelaces trailing in their wake. Climbing atop your vehicle - not difficult since it's been so thoroughly crushed - you stare upwards and note well-muscled, bare legs extending upwards into off-cut denim shorts. There's no time to look closer before those boots smash down either side of the car, and the giant bellows above you in a thunderous, female voice.

"What is that? Sure doesn't look like any cigarette pack I've ever seen before..." The boots creak as the feet within them force them to bend at the toe, legs collapsing as the giant lowers herself to inspect your wreck. The lighting's not too good here, and she's drunk enough to probably not be seeing things clearly, so as her gigantic fingers pick at the edge of your metal pancake, short-bitten fingernails peeling it up, it doesn't look like she's spotted you.

In moments, she'll have lifted your car into the air for a closer look. She's not paying close attention, so while you'd be closer to her eyes at journey's end, there's no guarantee you won't fall off long before that point, toppling a huge distance to the ground, probably to get underfoot again. The other choice would be to abandon this futile venture and try those shoelaces - you could tag along with her, and wait until she's sobered up a little before trying to contact her, although that would invite the risk of being lost along the way, while you acclimatise to your new size and strength.

Choose quickly!
15231.title: See Me!

choices: "We work together," they suggest, "and get to bottom of this."
"First," you say, "tell me all you know about those stolen files.
"Now?" booms a teasing voice.  "Now you belong to me."
153.content:
The sputter of a state-engineered engine rumbles and clanks nearby, steadily rolling closer. You look in your cracked mirror and see the one-eyed glow of an injured beast crawling toward you with a whine of steam. Thickly accented voices direct each other, "There! He is there!" Waiting inside your car for their approach, you keep one hand by your side, ready to draw if necessary, though you may fall into slumber before your guests arrive.

"Stop! Brake!" the dark-suited passenger shouts to the driver, who replies with an appropriately aggravated exclamation. They came to you, it's still their move. They raised the stakes high earlier, but now both sides seem hobbled in this sudden darkness. The two former officers hurry from their vehicle, but approach you with empty hands shown high. "Sterling? You are Sterling?"

You give no response beyond a sharp eye still watching for any sudden movements. "That's close enough gentlemen," you halt them well outside your door. The two men murmur to one another in Russian, something including your name. "Speak up!" You open your door and step toward them.

"I was," the talkative passenger continues, "You are Jack Sterling. We were warned of you. Just what I said." You ease your gaze on them only slightly, this whole situation still unsettling. "Mister Sterling, you have looked around?" Come to think of it, no, you hadn't yet, but now this could be a deceptive maneuver of theirs. The man points up to the dark sky, and all three of you view an abnormally large star above, pulsing directly overhead.

"What is that?" you ponder, a haze of pale, orange light beaming down from this object. You do not have to wait long for an answer, as the mustached driver replies, "Is a lamp. A streetlamp. Look." He motions an arm over his shoulder then over yours, revealing a whole row of equally spaced lamps receding into either horizon. You shout, "Blast! What have you done? What is going on here?"

The driver takes harsh offense to your remark, but the passenger holds him with his heavy English, "We have done nothing! It is you!" There is an awkward, questioning pause as you each consider the truth of the other. He concludes, "We are small." The driver echoes, "Very small." Now your turn, "And not one of us knows how it happened." You all agree in deep thought.

The driver speaks up, "What we do now?"
153.title: KGB Confusion

choices: Your call was a bluff. No one is coming, but you learn everything.
Your call was real. Diana will arrive soon to sort out this situation.
Your call was real, but Diana arrives pursued by her KGB counterpart
1532.content:
"First," you say, "tell me all you know about those stolen files." You take a whole step toward them as they retreat only one half-step. Raising your hand high, you clarify, "I want to know everything you do. Why take them? What were they? Who took them? Where are they? Who has them now?" Your driven interrogation has driven you almost atop their toes, so near you can see the breadcrumbs in the driver's mustache.

"We know nothing!" He tells you, a statement seconded by his companion. The more articulate of the two tries to satisfy your hunger with more basic information. "Mister Sterling, let us first know each other." You patiently allow him passage. He nods and continues, "I am Viktor, and he is Arman. I am certain you know already who we were. There is no logic in pretending longer. It is true. We were members of KGB, but no more."

"Save these kind details," you command. "Give me what I asked for." A rustle of foreign jacket like the flap of a bird's wings at night, handguns drawn, one shot, one shout. Arman's hand falls void of firearm, iron cannon punched through and away by your own quick reflexes. "Now don't try that again gentlemen. There's been enough of that already. Now answers, please." You keep the pistol in your hand as your new friends nervously press on.

"Okay. Okay, Sterling." Viktor speaks, "We are the ones that took the files. I, and Arman, and one other person who is no longer with us, you might say." He chuckles quietly, but you urge him on with a nod of your wrist, not the head. "The files are for big experimental weapon." He pauses and looks at Armand before firmly stating, "That is all we know!"

You smile. They smile too. You reach into your pocket. They watch you reach into your pocket. You remove a small phone and casually flip it open. They listen carefully. You seem to wait for an answer, "Ah, Diana darling. Yes, this is Jack Sterling." You pause appropriately to listen. "Diana, I'm in need of some assistance. I've got here with me our two favorite KGB boys, but it seems we're all three of us in an unfortunate position."

You bring the phone against your ear and listen carefully. "Yes, that's right. I was wondering if you could bring a car over for us. Pardon?" You notice the two men take a collective step backward, but you continue with conversation, "Yes, yes. Just follow the homing signal straight to me. Couldn't be simpler! We'll be here when you arrive, Diana. Cheers."

As you hang up and return the phone to your side, you address the men scrambling for their near collapsed horse of transportation, "Excuse me, but where are you off to? You will never be able to get away in that. I could walk backwards blindfolded and keep pace with that, so there is no way you could flee from my lovely Diana."

Ordinarily designed to signal to aircraft, in this instance it should be enough to attract the attention of a giant.

Of course, with his advanced state of inebriation and subsequent loss of equilibrium, he stumbles. Now is not a great time to be a shrunken secret agent, standing beneath several tonnes of falling man.

The crushing sensation you had been expecting does not come, as instead you are swept off your feet by the woman of your dreams. It's different to the usual cases of this happening as she literally scoops you into the palm of her hand, but as you gaze up at her awestruck, enormous eyes (totally ignoring the pratfall in the background), you wonder how you should play this.
1551111.title: Secret Agent Skills

choices: ...gets into a taxi
...is grabbed by someone
15511111.content:
One of your many, many gifts is your humility. As you look up into the overly-painted face of the prostitute you effect a bow, and upon rising see that a smile has instinctively split that gigantic mouth. Then it opens wide, speaking in Russian (complete knowledge of which is another of your gifts).

"What are you? Where did you come from?"

"Later," you shout,unsure if your voice will carry to her. "We should get out of here before the big lug wakes up." Your pantomiming over your shoulder gets the message across, and she rises and walks away, causing you to flounder somewhat in her palm. You wonder where this will lead, and are already spinning a cover story in your mind as the woman...
15511111.title: Gratz

choices: The prostitute screams and runs, alerting others to your presence
The prostitute jumps to her feet and attempts to stamp on you
The prostitute hesitantly reaches out to grasp you
1553.content:
That company car has provided you with good years of loyal service, but in a situation where it's little more than a dinky toy you're afraid that you're going to have to part ways. Still, it's with a tear in your eye that you sight your pistol at the gas tank.

A single shot opens the vehicle up in a fireball, along with the memories of chases and seductions carried out from its leather interior. None will be able to replace it.

Then the tower falls, its uprooted base descending from the clifftop to land at your level with an unearthly quake. Yet for all its scale, all its grandeur, the event happens in a fraction of a second, the giantess moving with speed disproportionate to her size as she hunkers down to inspect the small fire in the road.

With her more compacted, knees hunched to chest as she squats, you get a better look at her. A better look at the acres of pale skin, barely restrained within silks and leathers. A better look at the face, possibly beautiful underneath the field of harsh, accentuating make-up. A better look at your destiny.

That behemoth is the one that you're going to have to make contact with, so you shove your thoughts, your fears and your regrets aside as you sprint free from your minimum safe distance and put yourself right up close to the inferno.

The burning car radiates heat, but to her it can be little more than a small blaze, barely enough to warm one of her all-smothering hands. You present yourself to her, already feeling the sweat building up from the conflagration at your back, and hope that within her brain or heart there resides one iota of mercy.
1553.title: A Fond Farewell

choices: You run from her - you can always find another!
You run to her - her initial panic must be over!
15532.content:
The woman rises as quickly as she squatted, your brief glimpse of the sneer of distaste creasing her billboard face snatched away in a blur of motion. Still, it's enough warning to give your reflexes time to get you away as she raises and smashes down her stiletto-heeled foot.

The impact is stunning, even as you dash away, the noise piercing. She's careless enough to nudge the flaming wreck of your car,which skids away from her, forcing you to dive flat and allow it to careen over you. A bark of annoyance sounds far above, the most terrifying sound you have ever heard.

Could you outrun her? Unlikely. But could you outrun her sense of giving a damn? After all, what sensible person is going to waste their time chasing a bug around when they have business to attend to? Perhaps dashing across the street would make her grow bored and leave you alone.

Then again, perhaps she can still be reasoned with? Better that you try to calm one that has already seen you than search for a newcomer in a city run by enemy agents.

Oh, the dilemma!
15532.title: Death By Stiletto

choices: She gives you a chance to speak
She takes you to her 'boss'
15533.content:
You stare up at her face, framed by a bob of black hair with a single red streak running through it. Her scarlet lips part, and then your vision is obscured as her hand darts in to grab at you.

Even your honed reflexes couldn't hope to react in time, and you are grasped between finger and thumb in a moment, the casual strength of the woman reminding you all too painfully how pathetic your stature is.

You are brought before her face, where heavily mascarra'd eyelids bat furiously at you, the woman seemingly unable to believe what she's seeing.

And who could blame her? You have to communicate the truth of your situation to her - it's not just your fate that hangs in the balance now, but the destiny of the entire free world!

Not that a Russian prostitute is going to be thinking of that when she finds a tiny little man crawling in the street, one who is powerless before her whims...
15533.title: The prostitute hesitantly reaches out to grasp you

choices: You attempt to get back to normal as quick as possible
You attempt to seduce the woman
155331.content:
"And what is this tiny little man doing here?" she remarks. As Russian is one of the twenty languages you were schooled in as part of your extensive espionage training, you have no trouble understanding her words. The only real problem is the incredible volume with which she pronounces them; held mere inches from her face, you are buffeted as if by storm winds.

Her eyebrows arch, as she awaits a response, seemingly unaware of your discomfort. You are held immobile by her digits, and so must acquiesce to her whim. Question is, are you entirely sure that she isn't a foreign agent? Could this all be an elaborate set-up to capture you? Perhaps it's time for your quick-thinking brain to come up with some cover story that will allow you to get in touch with your contact, and help out of this impossible situation?

Then again, your reputation as a spy is exceeded only by your legendary status as a womaniser. While you have bedded hundreds of women of various nationalities across the globe, you have yet to experience sexon such a scale as your new... situation promises. Are you really in any rush to be restored to regular size? You could always have a little fun, first...
155331.title: Lucky Find

choices: The woman takes you directly to her home
The woman waits for a client
1553312.content:
"What," you begin, your traditional self-satisfied smirk probably lost on a giant woman that can barely see your face, "do you have a height restriction?"

"Huh? You mean -" She smiles as she catches on, then opens her mouth wide in a roaring laugh that buffets you with force and noise. "Haah... You are funny, little man. I think I will keep you."

Well, at least that means that you're not going to be crushed to death just yet. You prepare to say more, but the fingers binding you whisk you downwards and release, allowing you to fall down into darkness, the contents of the woman's purse coming up to meet you.
1553312.title: Seductify...

choices: Escape and seek help elsewhere
Ruin the woman's chances of getting a client, so she must help you
15533122.content:
And just like that, you're uncermoniously dismissed. It seems that the woman still has a job to do, and na unimportant speck like yourself can wait!

Trouble is, you also have work to do, and it's of international importance! Struggling atop the mound of cosmetics and sex aids within the darkened purse, you must determine a course of action.
